pageContext.claim: “You see what's happening with coal. Coal is coming -- clean coal. We love clean coal. And it's coming back.”
pageContext.analysis: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, only 600 jobs have been created in the coal industry since Trump became president — an increase of less than 2 percent. Administration officials often misleadingly refer to “mining” jobs, which mostly consist of jobs in the oil sector, which has rebounded from a price slump that has little to do with administration policies.
